sentences.sContent: You wouldn’t really tell her. You’re bluffing!
sentences.sCn: 你不会真的告诉她吧，你在吓唬我！

sentences.sContent: ‘I was with Don,’ she said, deciding to bluff it out (=  continue to pretend something  ) .
sentences.sCn: 她决定装到底，就说:“我是和唐在一起。”

phrases.pCn: 伪装而得以幸免；蒙混过关

words.tran: 陡峭地；船头扁平地；率直地；粗率地
吓唬人的人；用假像骗人的人

trans.tranOther: to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation
a bluff person, usually a man, is pleasant but very direct and does not always consider other people

trans.tranCn: 悬崖，峭壁；虚张声势，唬人
trans.tranOther: an attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something, when you do not intend to do it
